author: nero_eth
content:
Quick update/request-for-feedback regarding **[EIP-7976](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7976)** (CFI'd for Amsterdam): Iâ€™ve opened a [draft PR](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/11264#issuecomment-3854037466) proposing to change calldata pricing from **15 / 60** (zero / non-zero byte) to a flat **64 / 64 gas per byte** *at the floor*.

7976 builds on existing logic from  [EIP-7623](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7623) (Pectra) but instead of just increasing the constant, the draft PR makes zero and non-zero bytes cost the same once the floor applies.

* ~98% of transactions remain unaffected and continue to pay **4 / 16** gas.
* ~2% of transactions hit the **64 gas/byte** floor.

**Rationale:**
Cheap zero bytes allow worst-case *uncompressed* block sizes to exceed **10 MiB**, which we want to avoid. For max-size blocks, **zero bytes are just as bad for Snappy compression as non-zero bytes**, so distinguishing between them provides little benefit.

With current EIP-7976 pricing, ~10 MiB uncompressed blocks are reachable at ~**104M gas**.
With a flat 64 gas/byte floor, this remains safe up to ~**670M gas**.

**Impact:**

* **2.05%** of transactions over the last 6 months would have been affected.
* **0.85%** of those already paid the floor due to **EIP-7623**.
* Additional costs are highly concentrated among a small number of accounts.

Full analysis [here](https://github.com/nerolation/eip-7976-repricing-reports/blob/main/report_64.md).
